operation.name: create-clone
operation.documentation:
### Input
- resourceId: reference to the ActivityDefinition resource that should be cloned
- clone_operation: minor-version/major-version/copy Coding from codesystem: http://ehealth.sundhed.dk/cs/ehealth-clone-operation 
- default-clone-behavior: true/false. False signifies deep-clone mode where the list of deep-clone-references determine which resources should be cloned 
- deep-clone-references: References to resources to create as new resources rather than referencing the existing ones.

### Output
Bundle containing all resources that were created during the operation.

### Validation
- New business versions require that the user has modifier-role: owner or co-author for the resource
- New copy does not require that the user has a modifier-role.
- New business version can be made only when no draft resource exists (having identical base identifier).
- Read/search/create privileges are required for the resource types affected by $create-clone

searchParam.name: authenticator
searchParam.documentation: Who/what authenticated the document

searchParam.name: author
searchParam.documentation: Who and/or what authored the document

searchParam.name: category
searchParam.documentation: Categorization of document

searchParam.name: contenttype
searchParam.documentation: Mime type of the content, with charset etc.

searchParam.name: custodian
searchParam.documentation: Organization which maintains the document

searchParam.name: date
searchParam.documentation: When this document reference was created

searchParam.name: description
searchParam.documentation: Human-readable description

searchParam.name: encounter
searchParam.documentation: Context of the document  content

searchParam.name: event
searchParam.documentation: Main clinical acts documented

searchParam.name: facility
searchParam.documentation: Kind of facility where patient was seen

searchParam.name: format
searchParam.documentation: Format/content rules for the document

searchParam.name: identifier
searchParam.documentation: Master Version Specific Identifier

searchParam.name: language
searchParam.documentation: Human language of the content (BCP-47)

searchParam.name: location
searchParam.documentation: Uri where the data can be found

searchParam.name: patient
searchParam.documentation: Who/what is the subject of the document

searchParam.name: period
searchParam.documentation: Time of service that is being documented

searchParam.name: related
searchParam.documentation: Related identifiers or resources

searchParam.name: relatesto
searchParam.documentation: Target of the relationship

searchParam.name: relation
searchParam.documentation: replaces | transforms | signs | appends

searchParam.name: relationship
searchParam.documentation: Combination of relation and relatesTo

searchParam.name: security-label
searchParam.documentation: Document security-tags

searchParam.name: setting
searchParam.documentation: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty)

searchParam.name: status
searchParam.documentation: current | superseded | entered-in-error

searchParam.name: subject
searchParam.documentation: Who/what is the subject of the document

searchParam.name: type
searchParam.documentation: Kind of document (LOINC if possible)

operation.name: import
operation.documentation:
Import a Plandefinition
### Parameters
- planDefinitionPackage: Binary package produced by the export operation
### Output
Bundle containing the created resources. PlanDefinitions, ActivityDefinitions, and Questionnaires will be created. Libraries and Organizations are used to find the corresponding resources on the target system.

operation.name: export
operation.documentation:
Export a PlanDefinition.
### Export Contents
The export contains the PlanDefinition including referenced resources:- PlanDefinitions
- ActivityDefinitions
- Questionnaires
- Libraries
- Organizations

Each resource is returned in a separate JSon file.
### Parameters
- exclude: references to ActivityDefinitions or PlanDefinitions to exclude from the export.
### Output
Output can be found in Binary.content. This is a Base64 encoded .zip file containing JSon files.
All returned objects are Fhir resources. See the implementation guide for details

operation.name: create-clone
operation.documentation:
### Input
- resourceId: reference to the PlanDefinition resource that should be cloned
- clone_operation: minor-version/major-version/copy Coding from codesystem: http://ehealth.sundhed.dk/cs/ehealth-clone-operation 
- default-clone-behavior: true/false. False signifies deep-clone mode where the list of deep-clone-references determine which resources should be cloned 
- deep-clone-references: References to resources to create as new resources rather than referencing the existing ones.

### Output
Bundle containing all resources that were created during the operation.

### Validation
- New business versions require that the user has modifier-role: owner or co-author for the resource
- New copy does not require that the user has a modifier-role.
- New business version can be made only when no draft resource exists (having identical base identifier).
- Read/search/create privileges are required for the resource types affected by $create-clone

operation.name: apply
operation.documentation: Create a careplan for a specific episodeOfCare using this PlanDefinition as a template.

operation.name: process-message
operation.documentation: Accept a FHIR Message Bundle for processing

operation.name: perform-reindexing-pass
operation.documentation: Forces a single pass of the resource reindexing processor

operation.name: get-resource-counts
operation.documentation: Provides the number of resources currently stored on the server, broken down by resource type
